hero.title: About Us
hero.description: Diagno AI is an innovative platform providing medical diagnostics and doctor recommendations powered by artificial intelligence

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description1: The primary goal of the Diagno AI platform is to expand access to quality medical care and make healthcare services universally accessible using artificial intelligence technologies.
mission.description2: We aim to improve communication between doctors and patients, accelerate the diagnostic process, and enhance the healthcare system by providing remote medical services.

checklist.item3: Improving communication between doctors and patients

values.title: Our Values
values.description: The Diagno AI platform is built on the following core values

value1.title: Reliability and Security
value1.description: User data security and privacy are our top priorities. All data is encrypted and stored in compliance with medical standards.

value2.title: Quality and Accuracy
value2.description: Our AI algorithms are continuously improved and updated with the latest medical data. We strive for the highest level of accuracy.

value3.title: Speed and Convenience
value3.description: We provide users with fast and convenient access to medical care anytime, anywhere. 24/7 service is our core principle.

item1.title: The Beginning

item4.title: Initial Results

item5.title: Expansion Plans

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: DiagnoAI is an AI-powered electronic platform operating under the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan. It enables clinics and doctors practicing in Uzbekistan to efficiently manage medical processes, monitor patient health, and develop diagnostic and treatment recommendations. This Privacy Policy governs how DiagnoAI collects and processes users’ personal data while using the website and all services. Processing is carried out in strict compliance with the personal-data protection laws of the Republic of Uzbekistan, in particular the Law “On Personal Data”, the Cabinet of Ministers’ resolution approving certain regulatory acts in the field of personal-data processing, the Law “On Informatization”, and other applicable regulations. By using the platform, the user consents to the rules of this Privacy Policy. Under the Law “On Informatization”, information about individuals’ personal data is classified as confidential. If any aspects not directly regulated herein arise, the parties shall follow the legislation and business ethics of the Republic of Uzbekistan. Section 4 (“Rights and Choices”) details users’ privacy rights and how to exercise them.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.user: User – any natural or legal person registered on the DiagnoAI platform who uses its functionality.
definitions.personalData: Personal data – information recorded on electronic, paper, or other media that relates to or makes it possible to identify a specific natural person.
definitions.confidentiality: Confidentiality – a mandatory requirement for persons authorized to use personal data not to process or disclose such data without the data subject’s consent or other lawful basis.
definitions.anonymization: Anonymization – actions that make it impossible to determine the ownership of personal data to a specific data subject.
definitions.specialCategories: Special categories of personal data – data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, health status, or private life.

collect.title: Information We Collect
collect.body: We collect the following categories of personal data:
collect.identification: Identifiers such as name, e-mail, phone number collected during account registration or service inquiries. Pseudonymous identifiers (e.g., “User 00000”) may also be created.
collect.contact: Content of all messages you send via chat-bot or support channels.
collect.feedback: Ratings, suggestions, or ideas submitted through the “feedback” function in your personal cabinet.
collect.usage: Service-type used, access dates and times.
collect.cookies: We use cookies and Google Analytics to improve user experience. Google Analytics collects anonymous aggregated data such as pages visited, time spent, device/browser type, approximate city-level location, traffic source, and interaction patterns. It does NOT collect name, e-mail, phone, payment data, exact IP addresses, or any data that could identify you personally.

use.title: How We Use Your Data
use.p1: Establish direct communication with you in accordance with this Privacy Policy and the DiagnoAI Terms of Use;
use.p2: Send you service-related or event information;
use.p3: Create and manage your DiagnoAI account;
use.p4: Prevent fraud, abuse, or unlawful activity and protect the rights of the company and users;
use.note: We do NOT use personal data to train models or for any purposes not envisaged by the Law “On Personal Data”.

disclosure.title: When We May Disclose Data
disclosure.body: We disclose personal data only when required by Uzbek law or with your explicit consent. You are advised not to submit any confidential information while using the services; if you do, DiagnoAI is not responsible for protecting such confidential information. We assume no liability for disclosure of third-party personal data you may share.

rights.title: Your Rights and Choices
rights.body: Under Article 30 of the Law “On Personal Data”, you have the right to:
rights.r1: Obtain confirmation of whether your personal data exist and access their content;
rights.r2: Receive information on how your data are processed;
rights.r3: Obtain information on conditions of access to your data;
rights.r4: Appeal to competent state bodies or courts to protect your rights;
rights.r5: Grant or withdraw consent to processing (unless otherwise provided by law);
rights.r6: Consent to dissemination of your data for general access;
rights.r7: Demand temporary suspension of processing if data are incomplete, outdated, unlawfully obtained, or no longer necessary for the stated purpose.
rights.exercise: To exercise these rights, send a request to diagnoaiuz@gmail.com. We may ask for additional information to authenticate you. If your request is denied, you may file a complaint to the same e-mail. DiagnoAI will not discriminate against you for exercising your privacy rights.
rights.automation: Our AI services (chat-bot, document generator, legal analyst) do NOT collect special-category data. You are responsible for any information you enter.

crossBorder.title: Cross-Border Transfers
crossBorder.body: We do NOT transfer personal data outside Uzbekistan except as permitted by the Law “On Personal Data” (e.g., protection of constitutional order, public morals, or international treaties to which Uzbekistan is a party).

retention.title: Data Retention & Security
retention.body: We store personal data while your account exists. Upon deletion, data are erased in accordance with statutory requirements. We apply technical and organizational measures (regular security updates, physical access control, role-based access, staff training, vulnerability testing) to protect data against loss, misuse, or unauthorized access. In case of force-majeure events beyond our control (government actions, natural disasters, outages), we will notify users and take all feasible steps to restore data security.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.body: We may update this Privacy Policy. Material changes will be announced on the website and/or e-mailed to you at least 15 days before they take effect.

dispute.title: Dispute Resolution
dispute.body: Disputes relating to personal-data processing shall be resolved under the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan. You may also file a complaint with the Centre for Personalisation under the Cabinet of Ministers or with the courts.

terms.title: Public Offer Agreement
terms.subtitle: For the provision of online medical services by "Diagno AI"
terms.intro: In accordance with Article 369 of the Civil Code of the Republic of Uzbekistan, this document is intended for entering into an agreement with individuals (hereinafter referred to as the “user” and/or “patient”) and is offered by "Diagno AI" (hereinafter referred to as the “Platform”). Hereinafter collectively referred to as the “Parties”. This agreement is concluded on the following terms:
terms.public_offer: This document is published on the Diagno AI platform, presented for review on the information board, and constitutes a public offer for each user (patient) of the platform. The user is deemed to have agreed to use the medical services of the platform.
terms.acceptance: Full and unconditional acceptance of this offer is manifested through the registration and use of the Diagno AI platform (in accordance with Article 370 of the Civil Code of the Republic of Uzbekistan).
terms.agreement: Acceptance of the offer by the user (patient) signifies agreement with all the terms of this agreement and is equivalent to entering into a contract for the provision of medical services.
terms.validity: The validity period of this offer begins from the moment the user registers on the Diagno AI platform and remains in effect for the duration of the registration period.

terms_and_definitions.title: 1. TERMS AND DEFINITIONS
terms_and_definitions.1-1: "Diagno AI team" - the owner of the Diagno AI platform.
terms_and_definitions.1-2: User - an individual registered on the Diagno AI platform, provided with services such as using medical artificial intelligence, contacting a medical specialist, and connecting with available clinics on the application.
terms_and_definitions.1-3: Patient and/or user - the person receiving medical services.
terms_and_definitions.1-4: Medical specialist - an individual with higher medical education providing medical assistance to the user (patient) through the Diagno AI platform.
terms_and_definitions.1-5: Platform - located at the following website: https://diagnoai.uz, all rights belong to the "Diagno AI" team.
terms_and_definitions.1-5-1: Artificial Intelligence (AI) - a set of technological solutions that mimic human knowledge and skills, including independent learning and problem-solving, enabling results comparable to human intellectual activity in performing specific tasks.
terms_and_definitions.1-6: Order - an action performed through the platform to select a specific time for an appointment with a medical specialist.
terms_and_definitions.1-6-1: Booking - an electronic order made by the user through the Diagno AI platform to pre-select a specific time, place, and type of service for using the services of a doctor or medical institution. Booking creates an obligation for the user to receive the specified service and for the doctor (or clinic) to provide the service during the reserved time.
terms_and_definitions.1-7: Price list - the cost of services provided by a medical specialist to the user (patient), as determined by the platform.
terms_and_definitions.1-8: Medical service - actions performed by a medical specialist to provide medical assistance to the user (patient).
terms_and_definitions.1-9: Clinic - a legal entity established in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan and holding the appropriate license, engaged in providing medical services (including private medical centers, hospitals, polyclinics, or other types of healthcare organizations).

contract_subject.title: 2. SUBJECT OF THE AGREEMENT
contract_subject.2-1: Under this offer, the Diagno AI platform provides services of doctors with higher medical education in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan and facilitates interaction between medical specialists and users (patients), as well as communication between the user (patient) and others. The user (patient), in turn, undertakes to pay for the provided services in accordance with the platform’s price list and comply with the requirements of the medical specialist. The platform also utilizes auxiliary tools developed based on artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. The AI system may provide preliminary recommendations, analyses, and alerts based on the user’s input data, but this information does not replace a doctor’s consultation and serves only as a tool to support medical specialist decisions.
contract_subject.2-2: Under this agreement, the user (patient) understands the essence of the agreement and their actions and agrees that the platform management is not responsible for illegal actions (or inaction) of the medical specialist, adverse events, or harm caused to the patient’s health.
contract_subject.2-3: By confirming the public offer, the user (client) agrees to all the terms of this agreement.
contract_subject.2-4: The user (patient) agrees not to address complaints or claims to the platform management in case of disputes arising during the provision of medical services with a medical specialist. All disputes between the patient and the medical specialist are directed by the user (patient) directly to the medical specialist.

service_and_payment_terms.title: 3. SERVICE AND PAYMENT TERMS
service_and_payment_terms.3-1: The medical specialist provides services at the location of the clinic in accordance with the received order.
service_and_payment_terms.3-2: When the medical specialist uses their materials (syringes, systems, bandages, antiseptics, etc.) to provide services, the user (patient) must immediately pay the cost of these materials to the medical specialist.
service_and_payment_terms.3-3: The user (patient) makes payments for the provided treatments in accordance with the platform’s price list and/or the price list established by the clinic.
service_and_payment_terms.3-4: Payment for medical services is made by the user (patient) immediately after the services are provided or, by agreement of the parties, before the provision of services begins. The unit of payment is the national currency of the Republic of Uzbekistan (sum).

rights_and_obligations.title: 4. RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES

user_rights.title: 4.1. The user (patient) has the following rights:
user_rights.4-1-1: Use the platform at any time of the day.
user_rights.4-1-2: Connect with necessary medical specialists through the platform.
user_rights.4-1-3: Register on the platform only once and have only one personal account.

user_obligations.title: 4.2. The user is obliged to:
user_obligations.4-2-1: Timely pay the amount calculated by the platform.
user_obligations.4-2-2: Indicate the type of medical service and the time for which the medical specialist is selected when placing an order.
user_obligations.4-2-3: Be present at the clinic where the medical specialist operates at least 15 (fifteen) minutes before the scheduled time and, if intending to cancel the order, do so at least 3 (three) hours before the appointment with the medical specialist.
user_obligations.4-2-4: Pay a compensation of _________________ sum in case the order is canceled after being accepted by the medical specialist and/or clinic and after the scheduled time.
user_obligations.4-2-5: Provide the medical specialist with all information about other illnesses, contraindications to any medications or treatments before receiving medical assistance.
user_obligations.4-2-6: Provide a list of treating doctors.
user_obligations.4-2-7: Create conditions for the medical specialist to provide medical assistance and not interfere with the provision of medical assistance.
user_obligations.4-2-8: Behave respectfully towards medical staff during and after the provision of medical services.
user_obligations.4-2-9: Follow the instructions of the medical specialist.
user_obligations.4-2-10: Not provide false information or make unjustified bookings when reserving a doctor’s service through the platform.
user_obligations.4-2-11: Indicate the correct medical specialist when selecting the type of order.
user_obligations.4-2-12: Be ready to receive medical procedures from the medical specialist at the scheduled time.
user_obligations.4-2-13: Contact or place an order through the platform only for follow-up appointments with the medical specialist.

platform_rights.title: 4.3. The platform has the following rights:
platform_rights.4-3-1: Provide the user’s (patient’s) personal information to medical specialists and, if necessary, to law enforcement authorities of the Republic of Uzbekistan upon their justified requests.
platform_rights.4-3-2: Block or restrict the user’s access to the platform in case of violation of the platform’s usage rules or the terms of this public offer.
platform_rights.4-3-3: Unilaterally terminate this agreement at any time.

responsibilities.title: 5. RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE PARTIES
responsibilities.5-1: The platform (platform management) is not responsible for incorrect information entered by the medical specialist during the examination.
responsibilities.5-2: The user is responsible under the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan for distributing the medical specialist’s information to third parties without their consent.
responsibilities.5-3: The platform and the medical specialist are not responsible for possible or unforeseen complications (allergic reactions, anaphylactic shock, etc.) that may arise during the implementation of medical instructions.
responsibilities.5-4: The user (patient) does not make claims against the platform and medical specialists in case of death resulting from serious illnesses (cancer, life-threatening injuries, etc.).
responsibilities.5-5: The platform and the medical specialist are not responsible for the actions of other medical personnel who previously treated the patient.
responsibilities.5-6: The platform and the medical specialist are exempt from liability for failure to provide services under the agreement if this was due to force majeure circumstances (fire, natural disasters, vehicle breakdown of the medical specialist, road accidents involving the medical specialist’s vehicle).
responsibilities.5-7: In case of poor-quality medical services provided to the user (patient), claims and objections are addressed to the medical specialist in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
responsibilities.5-8: In case of violation of the terms of this agreement by the user or patient, if they are different persons, they are jointly and severally liable to the platform and the medical specialist.

force_majeure.title: 6. FORCE MAJEURE
force_majeure.6-1: The parties are exempt from liability for partial or complete failure to fulfill obligations if such circumstances are caused by force majeure, i.e., natural disasters, natural or man-made emergencies, confirmed by the relevant state authorities for a specific period. In this case, the deadline for fulfilling obligations under this agreement is postponed accordingly for the duration of such events.
force_majeure.6-2: Commercial risks arising from a decline in business activity, economic indicators, unfavorable market conditions, lack of necessary funds, price changes, failure of counterparties to fulfill obligations, changes in structure, legal form, work schedule, availability of necessary goods in the market, and other circumstances, as well as the amount of claims and/or lost profits, are not considered force majeure.

final_provisions.title: 7. FINAL PROVISIONS
final_provisions.7-1: This offer agreement is concluded in accordance with the civil legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan and remains in effect for the parties from the moment of its conclusion until the user deletes their personal account.
final_provisions.7-2: Matters not regulated by this agreement are resolved in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
final_provisions.7-3: Disputes between the parties are resolved through negotiations between them.
final_provisions.7-4: If negotiations do not lead to an agreement, disputes are resolved in court in accordance with the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
final_provisions.7-5: This offer agreement may be terminated by the user at any time, but this does not affect the fulfillment of obligations arising from previously provided services.

q1.question: Is DiagnoAI a licensed medical provider?
q1.answer: No. DiagnoAI is an AI-powered information tool and does not replace a licensed physician. Always consult a qualified doctor for medical decisions.

q2.question: How accurate are AI-generated results?
q2.answer: Accuracy depends on the quality and completeness of the data you provide. Our models are trained on diverse datasets, but results are probabilistic and must be confirmed by a healthcare professional.

q3.question: Is my personal and health data secure?
q3.answer: Yes. We encrypt data in transit and at rest, apply role-based access controls, and comply with Uzbekistan’s “On Personal Data” Law. No method is 100% foolproof, but we follow industry best practices.

q4.question: Can I request a refund?
q4.answer: Paid services may be refunded only if they fail to deliver the promised functionality and the failure is attributable to us. Contact support@diagnoai.uz with your request and proof of payment.

q5.question: Do I need to create an account?
q5.answer: Yes. An account is required to save your analyses, track recommendations, and consult with doctors.

q6.question: How can I delete my account and data?
q6.answer: Log in, go to Settings → Privacy, and click “Delete Account.” Your data will be erased within 30 days unless longer retention is required by law.

q7.question: Whom do I contact for legal or privacy concerns?
q7.answer: Email our Data-Protection Officer at diagnoaiuz@gmail.com or write to: Balcomsoft LLC, 81 Maxtumquli str., Tashkent, Uzbekistan.
